font.span: tit New Vocabulary: Conjugate To Be Hungry

div.font: J'ai faim,tu as faim,il/elle a faim,nous avons faim,vous avez faim,ils/elles ont faim
Tu as faim? Are you hungry?
Qu'est-ce-que tu veux? What do you care for?
Je voudrais...I would care for,I would like...

span.font: List 2 choices on each line. Example:
Then complete a dialogue:Qu'est-ce-que tu veux? What do care for?What do you want?
Answer choosing one of the choices you listed:Donnes moi une pizza s'il te pla
Intonation In French your voice rises after each group of words in the middle of a sentence ,not at the end like in English.
Write a dialogue on how you are thirty and what you would like to drink.
Make is a cartoon with dialogue if you wish.
Tu as soif? Are you thirsty?
ésirez? What do you wish for,or want?

div.div: In Class: Bienvenue and Welcome!
Go over curriculum,class expectations,homework policies
and the French 1 Novice page online
Introduce numbers and alphabet in class.
Bring a composition book to next class and a small dictionary
(you have a week to get the dictionary and the composition book).
In class: numbers worksheets to be handed out in class.

div.span: Instructions: Write the numbers in French 1 through ten and
then add the name of an object.Graded homework.

div.div: Example: deux croissants.
The Alphabet worksheet with vocabulary
Pas de devoirs! Bon weekend!

div.span: Write the days of the week and the months in French.
Remember : Days and months are NOT capitalized in French.
Make a weekly calendar with the days of the week and the 8 class periods
you have on your Long Trail Schedule.

div.div: We are going to have a great first year studying the basics of the French language.

div.span: The class will be held in the target language as much as is possible.I will try to speak in French as often as is possible with an occasional translation ONLY if it is really needed!
There will be homework every night so be sure to listen in class when we go over the assignments that are due.
These assignments will also be written out on the left hand side of the white board so you can copy them into your planner.
Homework for the week will be posted by 8 AM Monday morning of that week however changes might be made to the post with you in class and will be explained ahead of time.

div.div: Homework assignments must be handed in on the day they are due and there will be points taken off your homework grade if they are handed in late or not at all.
You will be given a week's notice regarding when we will have quizzes or tests EXCEPT for when we have a Pop Quiz! Those come as a surprise.
Your grade will be calculated using the following percentages:
Homework: 30%
Participation: 30 %
Quizzes and Tests: 40%
There will be several long - term assignments due that will take a week to complete as we get further into the academic year.
These projects usually involve making power points and or video presentations.You will always have the option to write these out and or draw them on hard copy paper or poster boards.
Last but not least come to class prepared,ready to learn and have fun.
Respecting each other, completing your assignments in a timely manner, listening and participating in class will be key .
This will enable us to have fun together while learning a new language!
Merci,
Veronique
